intro: Phacelia hubbyi, commonly known as Hubby's phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its small, glandular leaves and clusters of blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, which is known for its medicinal and ornamental plants. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
